page.title: 18Changing Times.School 1952.
page.content: When Mrs Martin came to Belford School there were 7 classes for children aged 5 to 15, with about 30 pupils in each.She paid 1p to travel in from Mousen on the service bus.Free transport was only for those who lived more than 3 miles from school.Many children cycled in. There was no wall on the corridor;the classrooms opened straight into the fresh air.Boys wore shorts all year and did P.E. in these, while girls wore navy_blue knickers for P.E. and wore white ankle_socks winter and summer.The showers were used by the seniors after games.The children worked silently at their desks all day.Reading was done from the board in the first class and even further up the school children were not allowed to take books home.There were no toys or televisions.
